page.title: 02Settlement
page.content: The area encloses the two parishes of {Fritton and Morningthorpe}with a combined{population}of{233. Morningthorpe is dominated by an {estate,}owned by a family with generations of association with the village. Much of the property in the two parishes is owned by the estate. Many of the{houses and cottages}are {thatched}and decorated in{'Suffolk} {Pink'.}Buildings of great age survive in good repair. Council houses, owned and leased by South Norfolk District Council occur in Fritton and Hempnall. There are many{isolated farms}and cottages scattered over the area. The only{industrial site}is{Leeders Mill, which processes grain on the site of a former windmill. Working people find employment mostly outside the area and many{residents}are{elderly}and {retired.
